intro: Scorzonera ovata subsp. crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its robust, fleshy roots and dark green, broadly ovate leaves. The plant produces yellowish to orange flowers in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and herbal practices.
